results.headline: Guys With Lots of Mileage, on the Road
results.summary_short: “Land Ho!” follows two older men on a journey around Iceland, learning that sometimes self-discovery just needs different vistas.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Land Ho!

results.headline: With the End of Days Near, a Sect Is Torn
results.summary_short: “As It Is in Heaven,” a low-budget debut by Joshua Overbay, was shot in just 17 days.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of As It Is in Heaven

results.headline: For One Team, It’s Sink or Swim
results.summary_short: Students from a low-income high school in Arizona win a robotics competition and reflect on their victory in “Underwater Dreams.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Underwater Dreams

results.headline: A Fugitive Who Stops to Smell the Flowers
results.summary_short: In “Road to Paloma,” Jason Momoa plays a Native American whose act of retribution sets the F.B.I. on his trail.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Road to Paloma

results.headline: Backsliding Into Brutality to Avenge a Daughter
results.summary_short: In “Rage,” Nicolas Cage plays a reformed mobster who forsakes the straight and narrow after his daughter is killed.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rage

results.headline: Don’t Bring That Boyfriend Home
results.summary_short: In Shan Khan’s “Honour,” a young British Pakistani woman’s relationship with a Punjabi man incurs her family’s wrath.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Honour

results.headline: If Gatsby Were Coming of Age Today ...
results.summary_short: In “Affluenza,” Kevin Asch’s take on millennials, pot, sex and golf are plentiful, but everyone continues to sulk.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Affluenza

results.headline: Very Modern Problems Set in a Navajo World
results.summary_short: “Drunktown’s Finest,” by Sydney Freeland, gives a look into the lives of young Native Americans in New Mexico.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Drunktown's Finest

results.headline: An Allegory Steeped in Enigmas
results.summary_short: “Closed Curtain,” by Jafar Panahi, is a film, or nonfilm, that mixes defiance and whimsy with an edge of melancholy and fatigue.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Closed Curtain

results.headline: Sleuthing Her Way to the Top, Cloaked in Many Disguises
results.summary_short: The Bollywood star Vidya Balan plays a woman who aspires to be the top detective in Hyderabad in “Bobby Jasoos.”

results.headline: A Toon’s View of Aging
results.summary_short: “Wrinkles,” an animated film based on Paco Roca’s graphic novel, follows nursing home residents trying to stave off their decline.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wrinkles

results.headline: And Fade Out ... but Not Fade Away
results.summary_short: The documentary “Life Itself” is a warts-and-all portrait of Roger Ebert, the most famous and affectionately regarded of American movie critics.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Life Itself

results.headline: Intoxicated by a World She Is Struggling to Own
results.summary_short: “Gabrielle” centers on a woman with Williams syndrome who longs to gain independence and revel in her romance with a man who shares her disability.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Gabrielle

results.headline: Those 3-D Effects Are the Bee’s Knees
results.summary_short: With re-enactments and archival material, Leanne Pooley recounts Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay’s ascent of Mount Everest.

results.headline: A Secret Retreat Morphs Into a Detox Unit
results.summary_short: In Bernardo Bertolucci’s “Me and You,” a 14-year-old hides out in the basement until an older half sister disturbs his solitude.

results.headline: Wanderlust as the Enemy of Love
results.summary_short: Daniel Auteuil has brought “Marius,” the first part of a trilogy by Marcel Pagnol, back to the screen in a remake, with two more films to follow.

results.headline: Faith, Severely Tested, in a German Commune
results.summary_short: In “Nothing Bad Can Happen,” a young German Christian joins a family that makes him suffer for his beliefs.

results.headline: A New York Cop Walks the Satan Beat
results.summary_short: A New York police officer teams up with a priest to combat demonic possession in the horror movie “Deliver Us From Evil.”

results.headline: More Than One Shot at a Good Day
results.summary_short: In the teenage-sex comedy “Premature,” a boy’s ejaculations jump-start his morning.

results.headline: An Ordinary Setting, Thick With Family Dynamics
results.summary_short: In “Lost Persons Area,” an engineer’s arrival changes life for a Belgian family.
